item.title: Effects of local drug crisis evident in Kamsack, Sask.
item.description:
Effects of local drug crisis evident in Kamsack, Sask.

If the first step to recovery is admitting there's a problem, three First Nations around Kamsack, in east-central Saskatchewan, have reached that point. â€‹Leaders of the Federation of Saskatchewan Indian Nations and the Key, Cote and Keeseekoose First Nations sounded the alarm this week about a crisis in their communities.

item.title: No Opiates For The Masses? | RealClearPolitics
item.description:
No Opiates For The Masses? | RealClearPolitics

There is no problem so bad that government-imposed remedies cannot make it worse, spawn new problems or both. A new confirmation of that phenomenon may be on the way, thanks to new recommendations from an agency intent on curbing the use of opiates.

item.title: Two drug mules spent six days in hospital expelling 90 swallowed cocaine pellets - Independent.ie
item.description:
Two drug mules spent six days in hospital expelling 90 swallowed cocaine pellets - Independent.ie

Two hapless drug mules from Limerick city spent six days in hospital expelling over 90 swallowed pellets of cocaine smuggled in from Spain. At Ennis Circuit Court, Det Sgt Kevin O'Hagan said that the two, Thomas Tully (44) and John Byrne (43) were initially detected by Ollie, the Customs drugs dog at Shannon airport after they came off a flight from Spain on April 21st 2014.

item.title: Marijuana Use Increases Violent Behavior
item.description:
Marijuana Use Increases Violent Behavior

New research published on-line in advance of print in the journal Psychological Medicine , concludes that continued use of cannabis causes violent behavior as a direct result of changes in brain function that are caused by smoking weed over many years. Researchers have long debated a possible link between use of marijuana and violent crime.

item.title: The Hidden Price of Mindfulness Inc.
item.description:
The Hidden Price of Mindfulness Inc.

Increasingly, mindfulness is being packaged as a one-minute reprieve, an interlude between checking Instagram and starting the next episode of "House of Cards." One company proclaims it has found the "minimum effective dose" of meditation that will change your life.

item.title: Full Measure: Drugs on the Border
item.description:
Full Measure: Drugs on the Border

Immigration is a big issue in this Presidential campaign and there's a harsh reality on the border that you may be surprised to hear exists in America. U.S. border towns are so influenced by the influx of illegal smugglers and drugs, that it has worked its way into the fabric of daily life.

item.title: GROWING OLD UNGRACEFULLY: Drugs, the Futile War
item.description:
GROWING OLD UNGRACEFULLY: Drugs, the Futile War

"Did we know we were lying about the drugs? Of course we did." - John Ehrlichman, Richard Nixon's Domestic Policy Adviser, interviewed in 1994 This is a follow-up to last week's column, in which I laid part of the blame for the country's ineffective, punitive and failed War on Drugs at the door of the late Nancy Reagan.

item.title: Pissed off London students protested high rents last night
item.description:
Pissed off London students protested high rents last night

The rent strike at University College London continues. Students in London took to the streets last night to demand their university cut the cost of rent, as a rent strike at University College London continues. Living in London isn't cheap, and students in the UK are facing a cost of living crisis.

item.title: More than HALF of suspects stopped test positive for banned drugs
item.description:
More than HALF of suspects stopped test positive for banned drugs

Some 60% of suspects caught on cocaine, cannabis or other banned drugs Senior police and MPs stunned at the scale of UK's drug-driving epidemic Warnings it raises 'massive concern' about how many people drug-driving 'Drugalyser' devices introduced in March 2015 detect up to 17 illegal drugs More than half of drivers stopped on suspicion of drug-driving are failing roadside tests for illicit substances, the Daily Mail can reveal today.
